title: Earthquake drill coming in bellevue
author: Unknown
text: BELLEVUE - With this week's Oklahoma City explosion as a chilling reminder of the destruction that can occur in a single moment, emergency teams in Bellevue are preparing for a different kind of disaster: an earthquak     Signs simulating damage and injuries will go up on buildings, streets and overpasses Wednesday as the city participates in a statewide drill. Roving crews will radio damage reports to an emergency operations center.     Because all city employees will be involved in the exercise to some extent, some nonemergency services may be delayed briefly. The drill starts around 9 a.m.     The Fire Department's emergency-preparedness division encourages businesses and residents to do their own quake preparation. For information packets, call 637-7923
